qas.question: How big is the satellite dish at the satellite ground station in feet?
When was the satellite dish installed?
Where was the satellite dish installed?
Both telephone and internet services are subject to what?

context: A satellite ground station with a 7.6-metre (<a0_0>25<a0_0/> ft) satellite dish installed in <a1_0>1989<a1_0/> at <a2_0>The Briars<a2_0/> is the only international connection providing satellite links through Intelsat 707 to Ascension island and the United Kingdom. Since all international telephone and internet communications are relying on this single satellite link both internet and telephone service are subject to <a3_0>sun outages<a3_0/>.
